name: Biggest Balls in the West
description:
The one and only western pinball game that requires huge balls to play. Literally.

Can one simple armadillo ball defeat a tumbleweed, a cactus, a tire, or the biggest ball of all, the sun?? Well, how am I supposed to know? I'm only the developer. Go play the game yourself.

This game was made for the 2021 Fall Game jam at Iowa State University. The game was made by the club officers, so it was made as an exhibition game. Obviously, if it were to compete, it is so unfathomably good that it would have blown away all competition, which is the only reason why the gracious officer team decided to enter as an exhibition entry. 

Credits:
Art: Hayden Havelka
Programming: Mitchell Talyat
Music and Sound: Alexandria Highlander
Machine Art: Winter

The game supports controllers, and is encouraged to use one.
